intro: Elaeosticta, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a genus of flowering plants in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. These plants are native to various regions in Africa, particularly in southern and eastern parts. They are characterized by their small, usually white or pale yellow flowers and their distinctive silver or grayish foliage. Elaeosticta species often grow as shrubs or small trees, and they are adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Some species are cultivated for ornamental purposes due to their unique appearance and resilience to harsh conditions.
